vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ὑπωπι-άζω,
strike one under the eye, give him a black eye:—passive, have a black eye, ὑπωπιασμέναι [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II metaphorically, bruise, mortify, [NT]; also, annoy greatly, wear out, τινα [NT+1st c.AD+]
vocabInfos.shortDef: to wear out, weaken; to beat up, treat roughly
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
to wear out, weaken; to beat up, treat roughly
primarily to strike one upon the parts beneath the eye; to beat black and blue; hence, to discipline by hardship, coerce, beat up, treat roughly 1Cor. 9:27; metaphorically to weary, wear out, weaken by continual importunities, pester, Lk. 18:5*
vocabInfos._es_Definition: cansar (a alguien) ; tratar duramente, tratar con severidad o mantener bajo control (1CO.9:27)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 眼圈打黑,擊中臉上 (路 18:5)
2) (一直攪亂)拖垮 (路 18:5)
3) 懲罰,嚴待,折磨 (林前 9:27)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 眼圈打黑,击中脸上 (路 18:5)
2) (一直搅乱)拖垮 (路 18:5)
3) 惩罚,严待,折磨 (林前 9:27)
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: làm bầm dập; làm nhức đầu; một phần của khuôn mặt dưới mắt; kỷ luật nghiêm khắc
